title: Westmorland
summary: Westmorland (/ˈwɛstmərlənd/, formerly also spelt Westmoreland;[6] even older spellings are Westmerland and Westmereland; the people of Westmorland are known as Westmerians[7]) is a historic county in north-west England. It formed an administrative county between 1889 and 1974, after which the whole county was administered by the new administrative county of Cumbria.
